intro: Canbya candida, commonly known as the white canbya, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are ovate and have a soft, hairy texture. Canbya candida is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in moist, sandy soils.
